title: Continuing minimal-defect production under material integrity cyberattacks
description: Contributed to an AI framework for real-time defect recovery in manufacturing processes
features: Demonstrated real-time in-raster defect recovery
Contributed to writing, reviewing, and editing
Created visualizations for the results

title: Throughput scaling and thermomechanical behaviour in Multiplexed Fused Filament Fabrication (MF3)
description: Contributed to the development of a novel thermal model and toolpath synthesis for MF3, improving throughput and mechanical properties
features: Enhanced the understanding of throughput scaling in MF3
Simulated mechanical behavior using COMSOL
Created visualizations for the results

title: PSPOnto: An application ontology to aid in data-driven materials design
description: Proposed an ontology to standardize material informatics (MI) datasets.
features: Developed PSPOnto, an ontology for Process-Structure-Property (PSP) relations
Created knowledge base for MI datasets
Assembled corpus on manufacturing process parameters
Enabled efficient data storage and retrieval for PSP datasets

title: Case study of a connecting rod: evaluating different design approaches
description: Optimized the design of a connecting rod for stiffness and mass.
features: Compared literature-based, TPMS-based, topologically optimal, and generative design
TPMS-based IWP hollow structure found optimal
Performed peoperty homogenization for TPMS structures
Performed Design for Additive Manufacturing for the proposed geometries

title: Establishing inverse process-structure linkage using a deep convolutional neural networks (CNN) approach
description: Focused on validating the importance of microstructre metadata and demonstrated multi-input multi-output CNNs to inculcate that information.
features: Modeled process-structure relations for Ultrahigh carbon steel and Ni-Co alloy
Achieved best results using microstructure+metadata input
Identified and addressed challenges with process-structure-property relations dataset

title: Experimental thermal analysis of phase change materials (PCM) in domestic refrigerators
description: Investigated the application of PCM to improve the energy efficiency of domestic refrigerators by elongating its refrigeration cycles.
features: Designed and built experimental setup
Improved power consumption by 36.28%
Extended refrigeration cycle time by 104.34%
1st rank in College Project Expo 2021
